title: Define Project Scope and Requirements - Revised
description:
This task aims to gather, document, and validate functional and non-functional requirements for the BioEnhancedCognition device. The scope includes: 
1. Identifying target users (e.g., individuals with cognitive impairments or healthy adults seeking cognitive enhancement) 
2. Specifying desired cognitive enhancements (such as memory improvement, focus augmentation, and cognitive flexibility)
3. Addressing safety considerations (like potential side effects, overstimulation risks, and user comfort)
4. Ensuring regulatory compliance (FDA, CE, etc.)
5. Securing data privacy (anonymization, encryption, and secure storage of sensitive user information)
6. Enhancing user experience through an intuitive interface and effective feedback mechanisms
7. Outlining integration with existing neurotechnology devices or apps
8. Considering potential future expansion or upgrades
9. Establishing the system's performance metrics and error handling mechanisms
10. Assessing usability for people with disabilities
11. Investigating compatibility with various operating systems
12. Detailing the product lifecycle management strategy.
Upon completion, the requirements will be reviewed by the project team before being handed over to development teams. It is advisable to create separate RFCs for each sub-task as follows: 
- Target User Profile (RFC 5930)
- Desired Cognitive Enhancements (RFC 5931)
- Safety and Comfort Considerations (RFC 5932)
- Regulatory Compliance (RFC 5933)
- Data Privacy Requirements (RFC 5934)
- User Experience Improvements (RFC 5935)
- Integration with Existing Neurotechnology (RFC 5936)
- Future Expansion and Upgrade Planning (RFC 5937)
- Performance Metrics and Error Handling Mechanisms (RFC 5938)
- Accessibility and Usability for Disabled Users (RFC 5939)
- Compatibility with Operating Systems (RFC 5940)
- Product Lifecycle Management Strategy (RFC 5941).
The project manager should decompose this RFC into the suggested sub-tasks, assign them to relevant team members as necessary and update the dependencies accordingly. Upon completion of each sub-task, they can be reviewed and approved before being handed over to development teams.
Update: The rfc_state field should be updated to 'NEEDS_DECOMPOSITION'.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including hardware components, software modules, and their interactions.

title: Develop Hardware Components
description: Design and develop the hardware components of the neurostimulation device, including the stimulation circuitry, sensors, and user interface.

title: Develop Software Components
description: Design and develop the software components of the system, including the user interface, data processing, and device control modules.

title: Implement Data Storage and Management
description: Design and implement the data storage and management system for user data, device settings, and cognitive enhancement data.

title: Conduct Security and Privacy Audits
description: Perform security and privacy audits to ensure the system complies with relevant regulations and best practices for handling sensitive user data.

title: Develop Testing and Validation Strategies
description: Design and implement testing and validation strategies for the hardware, software, and overall system, including unit tests, integration tests, and user acceptance tests.

title: Implement Continuous Integration and Deployment
description: Set up a continuous integration and deployment pipeline for the software components, ensuring automated testing, building, and deployment.

title: Create User Documentation and Training Materials
description: Develop user documentation, training materials, and support resources for the BioEnhancedCognition device.
